column4: I have no idea if installing lamp is what killed my gnome or not though. I haven't used the monitor on it in a long time...it has been all ssh access for the past 3 months or so.
ps ax | grep gdm to see if it's running
sorry about th delay, I did the command, how do I tell if it is running?
if you see 'gdm' in the output, the Gnome Display Manager is running.
odd. i haven't installed the LAMP stack as such on Ubuntu, only on Debian. i have played with Ubuntu Server Edition however, with no such problems.

when i loggedin the first time a window popped up for upgrades, so I installed them. there weren't any bars at the tops of the windows though....then I rebooted from my laptop. so nobody is logged in on the server accept for me through ssh.
in the console type 'pstree' and tell me what follows along the branch beginning with "login" in the output.
if there is no "login", look for "Xorg" directly.
I actually just tried sudo apt-get install ubuntu-desktop....it did install and didn't tell me that it was already there. I did a reboot just in case...then I'll try
there is a login screen. it comes up with a list of the users and then other....
thanks for the assistance btw. I really appreciate it.
still no desktop. I'm running the tree right now via ssh.
it says gdm-session-wor-----gnome-session and then a bunch of things off on the right.
is there a keyboard shortcut to open a terminal on the desktop?
i think there's an ALT-F2 or similar to bring up a run prompt. i'm on Debian here atm without Gnome..
